problem.p: The diagram above shows a uniform hollow cylinder with an open top. It has radius R and height h.
Find the center of mass of this cylinder, taking the origin of the coordinate system at the center of the bottom.

div.p: The center of mass for the bottom of the cylinder is in its center, and the center of mass for the curved part is in the very center of the cylinder. To find the center of mass for the entire object, use the equation for the position of the center of mass.

We treat the sides and bottom as being very thin, so that we do not have to worry about the bottom rim of the cylinder and whether it belongs to the bottom or the sides. This also lets us treat the area of the cylinder as if it were the mass.
\[ z_{CM} = \frac{2 \pi R h \frac{h}{2}}{\pi R^2 + 2 \pi R h} \]
